definition: surveyor's pole/post (used for a landmark)/CL:根[gen1]/(fig.) goal/model/benchmark

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
stick/pole/lever/classifier for long objects such as guns

sentences.english: Sergio Aguero is the benchmark sofar for chance conversion.
sentences.chinese: KUN在机会转化率方面是球员的标杆。

sentences.english: I decided to update last year’s post encouraging you to enjoy the race.
sentences.chinese: 我决定更新去年的标杆来鼓励你一起来享受比赛。

sentences.english: The post on the building staggered violently in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 楼上的标杆在风中猛烈的摇晃着。

sentences.english: Warren has a 'Health Assessment Tool' for readers of his Purpose Driven Life.
sentences.chinese: 华理克就有‘健康评估’来协助《标杆人生》的读者。

sentences.english: The utility model provides an automatic return position surveyor's pole.
sentences.chinese: 本实用新型提出一种自动回位标杆。

sentences.english: The Six Sigma Black Belt should be familiar with the limitations of benchmarking.
sentences.chinese: 六西格马黑带应该熟悉标杆的局限性。

sentences.english: Since when was Rodman a role model for normal, rational behavior?
sentences.chinese: 罗德曼什么时候是普通人，理性行为的标杆了？

sentences.english: While in the game press the key you assigned to the Benchmarking Hotkey.
sentences.chinese: 虽然在游戏中按您所指派的标杆热键的关键。

sentences.english: This oil drilling team is a pacesetter, well-known throughout the country.
sentences.chinese: 这个石油钻探队是全国著名的标杆队。

sentences.english: A protective copper strip was hammered onto the end of the post.
sentences.chinese: 标杆的顶端钉上了一块保护性铜条。

definition: to compare a product with (a rival product)/to benchmark against (another product)
to crane one's neck/to await eagerly/to lead/to show the way
one's conduct/deed/activity/accomplishment/achievement/to act as/as (in the capacity of)/qua/to view as/to look upon (sth as)/to take sth to be
fully deserving, without any reservations (idiom); entirely worthy (of a title, honor etc)
to follow sb's example/to emulate/(of troops etc) to dress (come into alignment for parade formation)
